data.title: P.O.D., Ja Rule, Iggy Pop, Fabolous
data.text:
Additional titles hitting stores this week include:

A new album from hard rock act P.O.D., “Payable on Death,” featuring the single “Will You.”

Rapper Ja Rule’s “Blood in My Eye” (Def Jam)

Two releases from singer/songwriter Ryan Adams: the EP “Love Is Hell” and the full-length album “lloR n kcoR” (Lost Highway).

The latest album from rock legend Iggy Pop, “Skull Ring” (Virgin), featuring several songs recorded with his former band, the Stooges.

A mix album from rapper Fabolous, “More Street Dreams 2: The Mixtape” (Elektra).

The 14th installment in the “NOW That’s What I Call Music!” series, plus a DVD with a separate track list (Columbia).

A live CD/DVD from U.K. rock act Coldplay, “Coldplay Live 2003” (Capitol), featuring the new single “Moses.”

Career retrospectives from singer/songwriter Sheryl Crow (“The Very Best of” A&M), former Led Zeppelin frontman Robert Plant (“Sixty-six to Timbuktu,” Atlantic) and Peter Gabriel (“HIT,” Geffen, plus the DVD “Growing Up Live”).

A five-disc, 142-song boxed set from beloved indie rock outfit Guided By Voices, “Hardcore UFOs Box Set: Revelations, Epiphanies and Fast Food in the Western Hemisphere” (Matador), as well as the single-disc compilation “The Best of: Human Amusements at Hourly Rates” and a DVD of the documentary “Watch Me Jumpstart.”

An album of previously unreleased recordings from late blues great John Lee Hooker, “Face to Face, Volume 1” (Eagle Rock).

A double-disc album of seasonal songs from Elvis Presley, “Christmas Peace” (BMG Heritage).

The debut album from Triumph the Insult Comic Dog, “Come Poop With Me” (Warner Bros.).

DVDs from Canadian teen artist Avril Lavigne (“My World, Arista), comedy/rock duo Tenacious D (“The Complete Masterworks,” Epic), U.K. rock act Duran Duran (“Greatest,” Capitol) and comedian David Cross, “Let America Laugh” (Sub Pop).
